description: Back-formation from reminiscence, from Latin reminīscēns, present participle of reminīscor (“remember”).

verbs.description: reminisce (third-person singular simple present reminisces, present participle reminiscing, simple past and past participle reminisced)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To recall the past in a private moment, often fondly or nostalgically.
(intransitive) To talk or write about memories of the past, especially pleasant memories.
(transitive, chiefly India) To remember fondly; to reminisce about.
examples: And now when life begins to get the best of meI reminisce these childhood memories
